key_points: Tiger Woods was seriously injured in a single-car accident in suburban Los Angeles.
The crash occurred early Tuesday morning, and Woods had to be extricated from his SUV.
He was undergoing surgery for multiple leg injuries following the accident.
The accident involved only Woods' vehicle, and the cause was not immediately clear.
The vehicle rolled over and was heavily damaged; Woods was hospitalized.
A second minor crash occurred near the scene with a vehicle that had stopped to help.
Woods was in Los Angeles for the Genesis Invitational and a TV shoot with GOLFTV.
The accident follows a history of physical setbacks for Woods, including numerous surgeries.
This is the third time Woods has been involved in a car investigation.
Athletes and celebrities have expressed concern and hopes for Woods' quick recovery.
spokespersons: Christopher Thomas (Spokesman, Los Angeles County Fire Department)
